senses.sense: (transitive) To set down (someone or something) from a vehicle; to stop and deliver or deposit (someone or something); to drop off.
examples: Could you drop me at the airport on your way to work tomorrow?
I’ll be dropping the parcel at your place later.

senses.sense: (transitive) To lower (a sound, a voice, etc.) in pitch or volume.
(transitive, music) To tune (a guitar string, etc.) to a lower note.
(transitive) To cease concerning oneself over (someone or something); to have nothing more to do with (a discussion, subject, etc.).
examples: I’m tired of this subject. Will you just drop it?

senses.sense: (transitive) To dispose or get rid of (something); to lose, to remove.
examples: I dropped ten pounds and an obnoxious fiancée.

senses.sense: (transitive) To cease to include (something), as if on a list; to dismiss, to eject, to expel.
examples: I’ve been dropped from the football team.

senses.sense: (transitive) To cancel or cease to participate in (a scheduled course, event, or project).
examples: I had to drop calculus because it was taking up too much of my time.

senses.sense: (transitive, slang) To lose, spend, or otherwise part with (money).
(transitive, slang) To pass or use (counterfeit cheques, money, etc.).
(transitive, slang) To impart (something).
examples: I drop knowledge wherever I go.

senses.sense: (transitive, slang) Especially in drop acid: to swallow (a drug, particularly LSD).
(transitive, computing, music, television, colloquial) To release (a programme, software, a music album or song, etc.) to the public.
examples: They dropped the album Hip-Hop Xmas in time for the holidays.
That hacker has been threatening to drop my docs [i.e. publish my personal information].

senses.sense: (transitive, linguistics) To fail to write, or (especially) to pronounce (a syllable, letter, etc.).
examples: Cockneys drop their aitches.

senses.sense: (transitive, music) To play (a portion of music) in the manner of a disc jockey.
examples: I love it when he drops his funky beats.
That guy can drop the bass like a monster.

senses.sense: (transitive, music) To perform (rap music).

examples: Warne dropped Tendulkar on 99. Tendulkar went on to get a century next ball.
